image.altText: A man holds up a medicine bottle.

props.synopsis: Scientists from the University of South Australia have worked for more than two years to develop an injection with the hopes it could one day replace the need for multiple daily oral medications.

title.children: Researchers hope new injection will one day be a 'game-changer' for people living with Parkinson's

image.altText: Table olives in hand with blue gloves on.

props.synopsis: Table olives are one of the most polarising foods — people either love them or hate them. A new Australian-style olive is trying to change that.

title.children: Why this farmer's olives now taste like passionfruit

image.altText: a woman with short hair holding a baby of Asian descent above her head, both smiling.

props.synopsis: Ute Young was only expecting one baby from Vietnam when she raced from rural South Australia to Melbourne Airport on Christmas Eve 1973. Instead, she was handed three.

title.children: A late-night phone call, a frantic flight and a baby in need of a mum

image.altText: Cockleshells on Goolwa Beach.

props.synopsis: A royal commission is needed to tackle the long-term consequences of the devastating algal bloom that is killing marine life and damaging industries along the SA coast, the state's opposition says.

title.children: Algal bloom 'disaster' prompts royal commission call as impact spreads

image.altText: A Sydney Swans player raises his hands in triumph as St Kilda players look dejected in the background after a game.

props.synopsis: The Sydney Swans trail most of the day against St Kilda before grabbing a season-saving win at Docklands, as Port Adelaide overcomes the Eagles in Adelaide.

title.children: Swans snatch points to keep finals hopes alive, Power survive Eagles scare

image.altText: Dead fish laying on the seabed surrounded by green waters

props.synopsis: New footage captured near a South Australian jetty shows scores of fish lying dead in "dark neon green" waters as fishers say the toxic algal bloom is affecting the industry. Warning: Readers are advised this article includes content some may find confronting.

title.children: 'Dead fish everywhere': Video shows underwater impact of SA's algal bloom

image.altText: Two Aboriginal men sit on a chair and show a small group of children how to use a Didgeridoo

props.synopsis: A new place for Kaurna people to gather and share stories has opened in Port Adelaide, and those involved say they will never forget the reception it has received from the local community.

title.children: 'Everyone comes here now': New culture centre a dream come true for Kaurna elder

image.altText: A woman in a grocery isle of fruit and vegetables

props.synopsis: Hundreds of Australian organic producers will need to be recertified to be able to continue exporting their products overseas after a major certifier goes into administration.

title.children: Aussie producers scrambling as major organic certifier collapses

image.altText: Ian wears a black coat and red scarf with hands in his pockets looking into the camera outside the a stone courthouse

props.synopsis: Ian Williams wakes up one morning to find $1,338 has been stolen from his account via two Google Pay transactions. Two years later, he's taking on NAB at the Supreme Court, with no lawyers to help him.

title.children: Pensioner robbed of $1,338 is taking NAB to court for millions

image.altText: Albanese looks serious, behind him is a dark background

props.synopsis: We are in an upside-down world now, where our greatest potential geopolitical adversary in our own region is love-bombing us and acting like the "adult" trading partner, while our real ally demands commitments from us it is not prepared to make itself.

title.children: China love-bombs Australia while US demands to know what we'd do in event of war

image.altText: Jim Chalmers GDP figures

props.synopsis: An incoming government brief released by accident to the ABC has given insight into Treasury's frank advice on Labor's 1.2 million homes target. Follow live.

title.children: Labor told 1.2m homes target 'will not be met'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Your housing target 'will not be met'
Questions about Australia's role in China-Taiwan conflict 'hypothetical'
Email blunder reveals blunt advice to re-elected Albanese government

image.altText: Jannik Sinner poses with the Wimbledon trophy

props.synopsis: Jannik Sinner outclasses Carlos Alcaraz to claim the first Wimbledon title of his career, avenging his painful French Open final loss to the same opponent last month.

title.children: Sinner creates tennis history after outclassing Alcaraz in Wimbledon final

image.altText: Beau Webster dismissed day two

props.synopsis: Shamar Joseph takes his wickets tally for the series to 20 as the West Indies run through Australia late on day two of the pink ball Test in Jamaica. Follow live.

title.children: Carey hit on head then dismissed as Australia crumbles under lights

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: BOWLED HIM! Webster falls to a beauty from Alzarri Joseph

image.altText: A group of people leave a courthouse. A man and a woman holding hands are at the front of the group.

props.synopsis: A Northern Territory police officer is suing the government for malicious prosecution after it took a Supreme Court jury less than an hour to acquit him of two counts of rape.

title.children: Police officer sues after being acquitted of rape by a jury in less than an hour

image.altText: An unidentified teenager stands next to wire fence and checks a phone

props.synopsis: Child victims of domestic violence have told a South Australian royal commission about being beaten, imprisoned in their own homes and made to feel "unloved", but felt ignored when they tried to disclose the abuse. Warning: This story contains content that may distress some readers.

title.children: 'I'm not very loved': Children share domestic violence experiences

image.altText: A Palestinian boy inspects the site of an Israeli strike that killed Palestinians in Gaza

props.synopsis: The Israel Defense Forces say a malfunction caused a missile to "fall dozens of metres from its target".

title.children: Children among Palestinians killed by missile that IDF says malfunctioned

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large red numbers, showing the price of shares which have fallen.

props.synopsis: Local stocks fall after a flurry of tariff announcements from the White House drove Wall Street down from its record high. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX down after Wall Street slips from record high on tariff worries

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Markets down on US trade uncertainty
Trump hopes Powell quits, as White House looks into firing

image.altText: Hands being held in support

props.synopsis: Androgen deprivation therapy is a lifesaving therapy used by thousands of men each year, but some patients are warning of serious mental health risks.

title.children: Side effects for common prostate cancer treatment raises concerns

image.altText: A man wearing a "free puff" shirt throws two peace signs outside.

props.synopsis: Sean Combs’s federal trial ended with him being convicted of two charges but, for some fans and supporters, the result was like an exoneration.

title.children: Sean 'Diddy' Combs's criminal conviction may not end his career

image.altText: Man smiling with his dog in front of backdrop of hay bales.

props.synopsis: Across the board, Australians are reading less, with young men reading the least and older women reading the most.

title.children: Australians, especially men, are reading less than ever before

image.altText: Evrim Sen inside her tiny house.

props.synopsis: Evrim Sen's tiny house on wheels has allowed her to have the serene and idyllic lifestyle she'd always dreamed of. But a council will see that come to an abrupt end.

title.children: Council issues building orders to shocked tiny home residents

image.altText: The wreckage of a white car crumpled against a tree that is behind blue and white police tape at night.

props.synopsis: The Armed Crime Squad is called after emergency services found a driver who crashed into a tree in Melbourne's north had been shot.

title.children: Driver critical after being found with gunshot wound in car wreck

image.altText: Play to learn centre in Castle Hill behind police tape

props.synopsis: A Sydney childcare chain experiences second suspicious blaze in less than a week after another facility was torched in the early hours of Monday morning.

title.children: Sydney childcare chain targeted with second suspicious fire

image.altText: A man standing at a lectern on a stage in a tuxedo.

props.synopsis: Cybersecurity business Cryptoloc shut down operations in December, mere months after being awarded a $15 million Queensland government contract.

title.children: Cyber entrepreneur who wooed pop stars and politicians files for bankruptcy

image.altText: A bowler celebrates with his arms out wide after taking a wicket.

props.synopsis: India loses four wickets late as England chases an unlikely victory at Lord's in the third Test.

title.children: Third Test on a knife's edge as England sends Indian wickets tumbling late

image.altText: A woman with long dark hair and a red scarf stands outdoors smiling lightly.

props.synopsis: Amalia Vatavalis was undergoing chemotherapy for cancer when her mother died from a brain tumour. When she asked her strata manager for a hardship payment plan for her body corporate fees, they rejected the idea.

title.children: Amalia was having chemo when her mum died but her strata didn't listen

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony in China

props.synopsis: Just as Australia is asserting that its national interests are different from those of both China and the United States, it seems the US may force us into a choice we don't want to make.

title.children: China was the big disruptor in our region. Now the US is determined to take that title

image.altText: Grace Kim smiles and holds the Evian Championship trophy, standing in front of an Australian flag

props.synopsis: Australian golf sensation Grace Kim wins the Evian Championship, the fourth women's golf major of the year, in epic fashion in France.

title.children: Grace Kim produces comeback for the ages to win first major title

image.altText: A photo taken from behind of an electoral official wearing blue vest.

props.synopsis: The ABC can reveal the WA Electoral Commission was warned about staffing issues in the seat of Roe as early as four months before the state's problem-plagued election.

title.children: Documents reveal chaos in WA seat as election inquiry remains secret

image.altText: GettyImages-2224347318

props.synopsis: Cole Palmer leads Chelsea to victory over PSG in the Club World Cup final as flaring tempers lead to a heated clash between players and managers after the final whistle.

title.children: Chelsea players bemused as Trump caught up in celebrations

image.altText: Tadej Pogacar rides in the yellow jersey during a Tour de France stage

props.synopsis: João Almeida, a key teammate of Tour de France leader Tadej Pogačar, is forced to abandon the race as Belgian Tim Merlier takes out a dramatic sprint stage.

title.children: Pogačar loses key ally as TDF sprint stage produces thrilling finish

image.altText: A large black and white orca breaches through the dark waves at a horizontal angle.

props.synopsis: Using sightings over four decades, researchers have pinpointed three main orca habitats off Australia, with key differences between each area's inhabitants.

title.children: Decades of sightings highlight split in Australia's orca populations
